name: Invesco Golden Dragon China ETF
description: The Invesco Golden Dragon China ETF (PGJ) is an exchange-traded fund designed to track the performance of the NASDAQ Golden Dragon China Index, which includes U.S.-listed companies that derive a substantial portion of their revenue from China. Launched in 2004, PGJ provides investors with exposure to the Chinese economy through firms primarily engaged in sectors such as technology, consumer discretionary, and healthcare. This ETF aims to capture the growth potential of Chinese companies while mitigating risks associated with investing directly in the Chinese market. As a passively managed fund, PGJ employs a systematic approach to index tracking, ensuring that it mirrors the performance of its benchmark as closely as possible. The fund's holdings include a diverse array of companies, from well-established firms to emerging players, reflecting the dynamic nature of the Chinese economic landscape. With its focus on U.S.-listed Chinese companies, PGJ offers an accessible avenue for investors looking to tap into the growth of one of the world's largest economies without the complexities of direct investment in China. The ETF is particularly appealing to those who believe in the long-term growth trajectory of Chinese enterprises and want to diversify their portfolios with international exposure.
